derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the senses 'dither' and 'haggle'): of unknown origin

entry.def: If you dodge, you move suddenly, often to avoid being hit, caught, or seen.

example.ex: He dodged amongst the seething crowds of men...
example.tran: 他在川流不息的人群中东躲西闪。

example.ex: We dodged behind a pillar out of sight of the tourists.
example.tran: 我们躲到柱子后面，避开了观光者的视线。

entry.def: If you dodge something, you avoid it by quickly moving aside or out of reach so that it cannot hit or reach you.

example.ex: He desperately dodged a speeding car trying to run him down.
example.tran: 他拼命地闪身躲开一辆试图撞倒他的疾驰的汽车。

entry.tran: (常指用欺诈的方式故意)躲避，逃避
entry.def: If you dodge something, you deliberately avoid thinking about it or dealing with it, often by being deceitful.

example.ex: He boasts of dodging military service by feigning illness...
example.tran: 他炫耀自己通过装病来逃避服兵役。

example.ex: Many struggling firms are ready to break the law by dodging tax.
example.tran: 很多挣扎求生的企业不惜违法逃税。

means.word_mean: 1. an elaborate or deceitful scheme contrived to deceive or evade;

sentences.sentence: "his testimony was just a contrivance to throw us off the track"

means.word_mean: 3. a statement that evades the question by cleverness or trickery
1. make a sudden movement in a new direction so as to avoid;
2. move to and fro or from place to place usually in an irregular course;
3. avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues);

auth_sentence.content: We did not dodge any of those important questions.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: We did not dodge any of those important questions.

sentences.en: He dodged cleverly when she threw her shoe at him.
sentences.cn: 她用鞋子砸向他时, 他机敏地闪开了。

sentences.en: He dodged the book that I threw at him.
sentences.cn: 他躲开了我扔向他的书。

means.word_mean: 回避,（尤指不诚实地）逃避

sentences.en: Whatever you do, work hard at it and don't try to dodge the column.
sentences.cn: 无论做什么事, 都要努力去做, 别偷懒。

sentences.en: A dodge behind a tree kept her from being run over.
sentences.cn: 她向树后一闪, 才没被车从身上辗过。

means.word_mean: 伎俩, 妙计,推脱的计策,逃避的诡计,骗人的伎俩

sentences.en: He tried all sorts of dodges to avoid being called up.
sentences.cn: 他挖空心思, 耍弄各种花招以逃避被征召入伍。

jushi.english: He dodged behind a tree so that she should not see him.
jushi.chinese: 他躲在树后,使她瞧不见他。
